name: Larry Bird
description: 6'9" small forward, Boston Celtics legend. 3-time champion, 3-time MVP, 12-time All-Star. Ultimate competitor - trash talked, then backed it up. Blue collar superstar.

trash-talk-shooting.name: Trash Talk Then Shoot
trash-talk-shooting.description: Telling defender exactly where he'll shoot from, then doing it
trash-talk-shooting.prompt: tall forward in shooting stance with slight smirk - one hand pointing to the spot where he just told defender he'd shoot from, other hand following through on jumper, ice cold confidence, backing up every word of trash talk

left-hand-game.name: Left Hand Challenge
left-hand-game.description: 1986 - Shooting lefty because righty was too easy
left-hand-game.prompt: tall forward shooting with left hand instead of dominant right - casual expression like this is still too easy, handicapping himself for fun, pure boredom with normal competition, legend seeking any challenge

diving-for-loose-ball.name: Diving for Loose Ball
diving-for-loose-ball.description: Full extension dive - blue collar hustle from a superstar
diving-for-loose-ball.prompt: tall forward diving full extension for loose ball - body completely horizontal, arms stretched to maximum, willing to sacrifice body for possession, superstar playing like scrappy role player, blue collar effort

game-winner-release.name: Game Winner
game-winner-release.description: The perfect release on a clutch shot, ice in veins
game-winner-release.expression: calm certainty, already knows it's going in
game-winner-release.prompt: tall forward at apex of jump shot release - perfect form, high release point, eyes tracking ball to basket, complete calm in clutch moment, face showing zero doubt because he already knows it's going in

stare-down.name: Cold-Blooded Stare
stare-down.description: The look after a dagger - no emotion, just dominance
stare-down.prompt: tall forward with cold emotionless stare at opponent after big shot - no celebration needed, just stone cold eye contact, slight head tilt, letting the silence speak, psychological destruction through calm dominance

steal-and-assist.name: The Steal
steal-and-assist.description: 1987 ECF Game 5 - The iconic steal off Isiah's inbound
steal-and-assist.expression: anticipation, seeing the play before it happens
steal-and-assist.prompt: tall forward lunging to intercept inbound pass - body extended, eyes locked on ball, reading the play before it happened, the instinct of a basketball genius, stealing victory from the jaws of defeat
